name: Sarah's Homemade Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}

name: Slow Cooker Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pumpkin pie spice'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Combine apples and water in a slow cooker.. Cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours.. Stir in brown sugar and pumpkin pie spice.. Continue cooking another 30 minutes.

name: Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: In a 2 quart saucepan over medium heat, combine apples, water, cinnamon, and cloves. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in sugar, and simmer 5 more minutes.

name: Applesauce for the Freezer
ingredients: {'quantity': '3 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or less to taste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3 inch) piece', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'strips lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Stir apples, water, brown sugar, white sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon stick, lemon zest, and salt together in a large pot. Place a cover on the pot and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until the apples are soft, 20 to 30 minutes.. Remove pot from heat. Remove and discard cinnamon stick and lemon zest strips. Mash apples with a potato masher.

name: Applesauce Muffins
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup packed', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'applesauce'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare a 6-cup jumbo muffin pan with liners or grease with butter.. For crumb topping, add butter, flour, brown sugar, and walnuts to a small bowl. Use a fork to combine until mixture is small crumbles. Set aside.. For muffins, whisk milk, eggs, and butter together in a bowl. Add brown sugar, applesauce, and vanilla. Whisk until blended. Set aside.. In a separate bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg. Add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients and carefully fold in just until combined. Fill each muffin tin about 2/3 full with batter and sprinkle evenly with crumb topping.. Bake in the preheated oven just until a toothpick comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Remove muffins from the pan to cool on a rack.

name: Cranberry Sauce Extraordinaire
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, peeled and pureed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apple - peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pear - peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped dried mixed fruit'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped pecans'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}
steps: In a medium saucepan, boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Reduce the heat to simmer, and stir in cranberries, pureed orange, apple, pear, dried fruit, pecans, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries burst. Remove from heat, and let cool to room temperature.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Apples
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed and sorted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}

name: No Cook Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Blend apples, brown sugar, water, lemon juice, and cinnamon in a blender until smooth.

name: Willis Farm Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cinnamon candies (such as Red Hots®)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Combine apples and water in a large pot over medium heat; bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.. Stir cinnamon candies and sugar into apples and water; return mixture to a simmer and cook until candies melt, about 15 minutes.. Remove pot from heat and set aside until mixture cools, about 15 minutes.. Mash apples with a potato masher until no large chunks remain. Alternately, you can blend the mixture with an immersion blender to get a smoother applesauce.

name: Blushing Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'unpeeled Macintosh apples, quartered and cored'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}
steps: Place apples in a large pot with sugar, water, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until apples are very soft and lose their shape, about 25 minutes.. Remove apples from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Puree apples in a food processor or food mill. If using the food processor, strain apples through a sieve to remove pieces of apple skin.. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve at room temperature or refrigerate and serve cold.

name: Slow Cooker Cider Applesauce (No Sugar Added)
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}
steps: Layer apples in a slow cooker. Sprinkle cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg over apples.. Cook on High until apples are soft, 4 to 5 hours. Whisk apples vigorously for a chunkier-style applesauce. Puree with an immersion blender for a smoother applesauce.

name: Doug's Easy Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}
steps: Mix apples, brown sugar, cinnamon, lemon juice, apple cider, and salt together in a large pot over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for until apples are soft, about 20 minutes. Use a potato masher while cooking to help break down the apples. Serve warm or cool.

name: Easy Cranberry Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and cut into 1-inch chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}
steps: Stir apples, cranberries, sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt together in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and cook until apples and cranberries are tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat.. Stir lemon juice into cranberry mixture.. Mash cranberry mixture with a wooden spoon or fork to make a chunky sauce.

name: Instant Pot® Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1/4 inch thick) slice', 'name': 'fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'star anise pod'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': '1 piece cheesecloth'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and quartered'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar, or more to taste'}
steps: Use a vegetable peeler to remove 2 thick strips of lemon peel, being careful to avoid the bitter pith. Tie up lemon peel, cinnamon stick, ginger, star anise, and cloves in cheesecloth for easy retrieval after cooking.. Place apples in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Add cheesecloth bundle, water, and salt. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 15 to 20 minutes. Avoid releasing pressure manually as hot applesauce may splutter up through the vent. Remove the cheesecloth bundle with a slotted spoon and discard.. Mix brown sugar into the applesauce until dissolved. Taste and adjust the level of sweetness if needed.

name: Holiday Cranberry and Apple Compote
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'Fuji apples, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pumpkin pie spice, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, softened'}
steps: Combine orange juice, apples, cranberries, white sugar, brown sugar, and pumpkin pie spice in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until apples are tender and sauce has thickened slightly, 20 to 25 minutes.. Transfer sauce to a dish; stir in softened butter and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. Sauce will continue to thicken.

name: What's the Difference Between Applesauce and Apple Butter?
Superb Cranberry Sauce with Apples and Pears
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '(3 inch)', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole allspice berries'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Gala apples, peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Bosc pears, peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}
steps: Place the cinnamon sticks, allspice berries, and cloves onto the center of a 8 inch square piece of cheesecloth. Gather together the edges of the cheesecloth, and tie with kitchen twine to secure. Place the sachet into a large saucepan along with the cranberries and orange juice. Bring to a boil over high heat, and cook until the berries begin to burst, about 10 minutes.. Stir in the apples, pears, white sugar, and brown sugar. Return to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer about 25 minutes until the apples and pears are slightly soft. Remove and discard the spice sachet. Scrape the sauce into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate overnight. Serve cold.

name: Rosy Strawberry Rhubarb Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'Red Delicious apples, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'hulled and halved strawberries'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'finely chopped rhubarb'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract, or to taste'}
steps: Combine apples, strawberries, rhubarb, sugar, and water in a large pot. Bring to a boil; cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until apples are tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.

name: Instant Pot® Pear-Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'Golden Delicious apples'}, {'quantity': '1 ⅛', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'red Anjou pears'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}
steps: Fill a large bowl halfway with water. Add lemon juice and mix. Peel, core, and slice apples and pears, putting them in the lemon water to prevent browning.. Drain fruit; do not rinse. Place drained fruit, 1/4 cup water, and cinnamon stick in a multi-functional electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Set the Manual mode to high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 3 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, up to 15 minutes. Unlock lid. Remove and discard cinnamon stick. Pass the cooked fruit through a food mill; sauce will be slightly coarse. Blend fruit with an immersion blender for a smoother sauce.

name: Chunky Cinnamon-Orange Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and cut into large chunks'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'freshly squeezed orange juice'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'orange zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly squeezed lemon juice'}
steps: Cook apples and orange juice in a large heavy pot over medium heat, stirring frequently, until apples begin to soften, about 10 minutes. Stir white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, orange zest, lemon zest, nutmeg, and lemon juice into apples. Cook, stirring often, until applesauce is chunky and thickened, about 25 minutes. Serve warm or chilled.

name: Apple-Pear Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Red Delicious apples - peeled, cored, and cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Asian pears - peeled, cored, and cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir apples, Asian pears, and apple cider together in the skillet until the fruit is mushy, about 10 minutes.. Smash the apples and pears with the back of a wooden spoon until no large chunks remain; continue cooking until thickened, 20 to 30 minutes more.. Stir sugar and cinnamon into the sauce; cook, stirring occasionally, until the sugar dissolves completely, 5 to 7 minutes more.

name: Quince-Apple Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'quinces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'apples'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar, or more to taste'}
steps: Inspect two 16-ounce jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones. Immerse in simmering water until applesauce is ready. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water.. Combine water, quinces, and lemon juice in a pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until softened, 8 to 10 minutes. Add apples and sugar and simmer until all fruit is very soft, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat and strain through a sieve.. Reheat apple-quince mixture until hot, stirring constantly.. Immediately pack quince-apple sauce into hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles. Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any spills. Top with lids and screw rings on tightly.. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water. Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder. Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 5 minutes.. Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours. Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down. Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area.

name: Cranberry Pomegranate Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tart apples'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pomegranates, peeled and seeds separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 fl oz) bottle', 'name': 'pomegranate juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'oranges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bags', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed and sorted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pecans, chopped'}
steps: Peel and core apples, and put peelings and cores in a small saucepan with pomegranate seeds, 1/2 cup juice, and 1/2 cup sugar. Bring to a boil, and then reduce heat to simmer. Cook for 30 minutes.. Chop the peeled apples, and place in a large saucepan. Remove zest from half of one orange, chop very fine, and add to apples. Peel oranges, chop coarsely, and add to pan along with cranberries and remaining juice and sugar. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer, and cook for 30 minutes.. Remove small pan from heat, and strain juice into larger pan. Cool solids slightly, and then push though a sieve to remove seeds and peels, adding remaining pulp to larger pan. Stir in nuts, if desired. Cook about 10 minutes longer. Serve warm, room temperature, or chilled.

name: Rhubarb Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'peeled and thinly sliced apples'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sliced rhubarb'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Combine apples, rhubarb, apple cider, sugar, and cinnamon in a large saucepan. Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes.. Transfer to a mixing bowl and mix on medium-high speed until all chunks are gone. Serve warm.

name: Slow-Cooker Apple Raspberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green apples - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg, or more to taste (Optional)'}
steps: Combine apples, raspberries, water, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a slow cooker crock.. Cook on Low until apples can easily be mashed, about 6 hours.

name: Apple Raisin Compote
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'salted butter'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped apples and turn to coat. Cook apples, stirring frequently, until golden in color, 15 to 20 minutes.. Slowly stir maple syrup, water, brown sugar, raisins, and cinnamon into the apples. Reduce heat and simmer until a thick syrup forms, about 15 minutes.. Remove from heat and let stand for several minutes to thicken. Serve hot, or refrigerate and serve cold.

name: Rice Cooker Recipe: Raspberry Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples, cored and sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen raspberries'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Place apples and raspberries in the rice cooker; add brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Add honey, vanilla extract, lemon juice, and water, in respective order.. Set rice cooker to standard "cook" setting, about 30 minutes. Stir mixture halfway through cooking cycle, mashing apples a little bit.. Remove the applesauce from the heat and cool for 30 minutes. Transfer applesauce to a bowl and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.

name: Grandma's Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'navel oranges - washed thoroughly, unpeeled, cut into quarters'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pecans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}
steps: Place the cranberries, oranges, apples, pecans, and sugar in the bowl of a food processor. Process until all ingredients are evenly ground, 2-3 minutes. Pour mixture into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate at least 2 days before serving.

name: Lemon Ginger Cranberry Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemonade concentrate'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Stir cranberries, apples, water, sugar, and lemonade concentrate together in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally, and reduce heat to medium low.. Stir ginger and salt into cranberry mixture and simmer until cranberries burst and apples are tender, 20 minutes. Chill in the refrigerator.

name: Spiced Apple Topping for Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond milk'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pure maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Combine flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt in a small bowl.. Grease a pie pan or 8-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Place apple slices in the prepared pan and sprinkle with flour mixture. Drizzle milk, maple syrup, and vanilla over top; toss to coat.. Bake in the preheated oven until apples are tender (not mushy), 25 to 30 minutes.

name: Cran-Apple-Pear Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(16 ounce) cans', 'name': 'whole berry cranberry sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(20 ounce) can', 'name': 'apple pie filling'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'sliced pears, drained'}
steps: In a medium bowl, stir together the cranberry sauce, apple pie filling and pears. Chill until serving.

name: Sam's Kicking Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole cranberry sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) jar', 'name': 'orange marmalade'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apple - peeled, cored, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange liqueur'}
steps: In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the fresh whole cranberries, cranberry sauce, orange marmalade, onion, apple, green bell pepper, salt, jalapeno, lime juice and liqueur.. Cook until cranberries crack open. Reduce heat and simmer until contents reduce by one third (approximately 3 hours). Remove from heat, cover and allow to cool overnight.

name: Awesome and Easy Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Gala apple, cored and cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pear, cored and cut into bite-size chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or more to taste'}
steps: Stir the cranberries, Gala apple, pear, lemon juice, water, and white sugar together in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and cook at a simmer until the cranberries pop and the liquid is absorbed, 20 to 30 minutes.

name: Fresh Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}
steps: Place apples in a large saucepan and just barely cover with water. Simmer over medium-low heat until apples are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.. Run cooked apples through a food mill or blender. Stir in the sugar and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat for about 3 to 5 minutes.
